Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with added red bands; exterior: three maeander pattern friezes between black bands; below, part of two rising rays.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leipzig, Institut für Klassische Archäologie und Antikenmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd was lost in WWII. Lemos incorrectly identifies the sherd as belonging to the rim of the chalice. The triple maeander frieze is a frequent feature in the handle zone of Wild Goat Style chalices and rays are always featured on the cul.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 244, no. 268, pl. 32, no. 268)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0214) (phase 2)
